thread.title: Dairy price plunge hurts Bega Cheese
thread.title_full: Dairy price plunge hurts Bega Cheese

author: news.com.au
title: Dairy price plunge hurts Bega Cheese
text:
TUMBLING dairy prices have eaten a hole in profits for Bega Cheese.
THE company's net profit dived 81 per cent to $12.4 million in the year to June as producers flooded the market with dairy products, causing a collapse in prices.
The result was also affected by Bega's sale of its shares in Warrnambool Cheese and Butter and costs from the introduction of a milk sustainability program. Excluding those significant items, underlying profit fell 26 per cent to an expected $22 million. A $29 million drop in the value of global dairy sales, particularly skim milk powder, had a big impact on Bega's bottom line. While profits were lower, Bega said it had responded well to falling prices and strong competition for milk supply. Revenues for the company's packaged goods and nutritional products rose by a combined $72 million, partly thanks to strong demand for infant formula and children's "growing up" dairy-based powders. Dairy prices have been falling steadily as heavyweights Russia and China ramped up production, while New Zealand, the United States and Europe have also increased dairy output. Dairy Australia last week estimated milk powder prices had fallen to between $1,500 and $2,000 a tonne, from $5,000. PRICE COLLAPSE HITS BEGA CHEESE PROFIT * Net Profit: down 81pct to $12.4m * Revenue: up 4pct to $1.1b * Final dividend: steady at 4.5 cents a share.
